titles.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to permit the Attorney General to waive the requirement that an applicant for naturalization take an oath of renunciation and allegiance in cases where the applicant is unable to understand its meaning because of a disability or mental impairment.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 4/8/1997--Introduced. Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to authorize the Attorney General to waive the naturalization oath of allegiance requirement in instances of physical or developmental disability or mental impairment.
